Package org.example.unogame.model.game

Class GameUno

java.lang.Object
org.example.unogame.model.game.GameUno
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IGameUno
public class GameUno extends Object implements IGameUno, Serializable
Core model for an Uno match.

This class coordinates game setup, card draws, card plays, and simple queries for visible cards used by the UI layer. It references the human and machine players, the shared deck, and the table (discard pile/top card).

Thread-safety

This class is not thread-safe. If accessed concurrently, callers must apply external synchronization.

See Also:

      public GameUno(Player humanPlayer, Player machinePlayer, Deck deck, Table table)
      Constructs a new GameUno instance with the provided collaborators.
      Parameters:
      humanPlayer - the human player participating in the game
      machinePlayer - the machine player participating in the game
      deck - the deck of cards shared by both players
      table - the table where cards are placed during the game

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame() throws GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck, GameException.NullCardException
      Starts the game by dealing the opening hands and placing the initial table card.
      • Deals 5 cards to the human player and 5 to the machine.
      • Draws cards from the deck until a numeric card is found (0â€“9) and places it on the table.
      Specified by:
      startGame in interface IGameUno
      Throws:
      GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck - if the deck runs out of cards while dealing or selecting the initial card
      GameException.NullCardException - if a null card is unexpectedly encountered while dealing

    • eatCard

      public void eatCard(Player player, int numberOfCards) throws GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck, GameException.NullCardException
      Allows a player to draw a specified number of cards from the deck.
      Specified by:
      eatCard in interface IGameUno
      Parameters:
      player - the player who will draw cards
      numberOfCards - the number of cards to draw (must be non-negative)
      Throws:
      GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck - if the deck runs out of cards while drawing
      GameException.NullCardException - if a drawn card is unexpectedly null

    • haveSungOne

      public void haveSungOne(String playerWhoSang) throws GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck, GameException.NullCardException
      Handles the event where a player has shouted "UNO", causing the opponent to draw a penalty card.
      Specified by:
      haveSungOne in interface IGameUno
      Parameters:
      playerWhoSang - identifier of the player who shouted "UNO" (e.g., "HUMAN_PLAYER")
      Throws:
      GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck - if the deck has no cards to draw for the penalty
      GameException.NullCardException - if a drawn card is unexpectedly null

    • getCurrentVisibleCardsHumanPlayer

      public Card[] getCurrentVisibleCardsHumanPlayer(int posInitCardToShow) throws GameException.InvalidCardIndex
      Returns up to four currently visible cards from the human player's hand, starting at posInitCardToShow. Intended for paginated UI display.

      If the player has no cards or the starting position is beyond the hand size, an empty array is returned.

      Specified by:
      getCurrentVisibleCardsHumanPlayer in interface IGameUno
      Parameters:
      posInitCardToShow - zero-based starting index of the visible window
      Returns:
      an array (length 0â€“4) of visible cards
      Throws:
      GameException.InvalidCardIndex - if an internal access computes an invalid index

    • getCurrentVisibleCardsMachinePlayer

      public Card[] getCurrentVisibleCardsMachinePlayer(int posInitCardToShow) throws GameException.InvalidCardIndex
      Returns up to four currently visible cards from the machine player's hand, starting at posInitCardToShow. Intended for paginated UI display.

      If the player has no cards or the starting position is beyond the hand size, an empty array is returned.

      Specified by:
      getCurrentVisibleCardsMachinePlayer in interface IGameUno
      Parameters:
      posInitCardToShow - zero-based starting index of the visible window
      Returns:
      an array (length 0â€“4) of visible cards
      Throws:
      GameException.InvalidCardIndex - if an internal access computes an invalid index

    • isGameOver

      public Boolean isGameOver()
      Indicates whether the game should be considered over.

      Current rule: the game ends when the deck becomes empty.

      Specified by:
      isGameOver in interface IGameUno
      Returns:
      true if the deck has no cards left; false otherwise
